newsitem.title: FRANCE: EP approves Commission proposals on fishing sector.
newsitem.headline: EP approves Commission proposals on fishing sector.

text.p: Euro-MPs on Friday approved three European Commission proposals on the European Union fishing industry and referred a fourth back to committee, pending a full debate with the Commission in January.
The European Parliament approved a draft decision on restructuring the EU fishing industry between 1997 and 2002 -- COM(96)237.
Euro-MPs also endorsed two draft regulations on monitoring systems -- COM(96)232 and COM(96)286.

A draft regulation on technical measures for conserving fish stocks was referred back to parliament's fisheries committee after the commissioner responsible for fisheries, Emma Bonino, promised a full debate on the issue at the parliament's January 13-17 plenary session.
